document.docAuthor: Scarbrough, Aubrey G. & Perez-Gelabert, Daniel E.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the asilid (Diptera) fauna from Hispaniola with six genera new to the island, fifteen new species, and checklist

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the asilid (Diptera) fauna from Hispaniola with six genera new to the island, fifteen new species, and checklist

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Asilus stylata Fabricius, 1775: 795
. Type locality: St. Croix, U. S. Virgin Islands , type : ♀ (ZMUC).
Erax haitiensis Macquart, 1848: 188
(
1848: 28
) Type locality: Haiti , type : ♂ . Curran, (1931) 9:9.
Efferia stylata (Fabricius)
.
Martin & Papavero, 1970: 68
. New comb. Distribution, Cuba , Haiti ,

subSubSection.paragraph: Puerto Rico , Santo Domingo, U. S. Virgin Islands (St. Croix, St. Thomas).

caption.paragraph: TABLE 1. A check list of asilids of Hispaniola (Haiti=H, Dominican Republic=DR).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Efferia stylata
was described in the genus
Asilus
and later transferred to
Efferia .
Presently it is reported as widespread in the West Indies. The identity and distribution of the species is problematic since the type , a female, is essentially destroyed. No new records are reported here.
